results.content: Surprisingly even with days missed,  I'm still able to follow him pretty dog gone well. I recall learning all of these rules , yet not understanding how I was going to use them. He's showing me how I will use them and in what circumstances . Which is making this a lot of interesting fun.  I'm applying all the rules and getting some great applications done, as long as everything works it's fun. Yet the most interesting thing I found,  is now that I have some rules under my belt, I am beginning to be able to find my mistakes myself. Their always little ones. But it's amazing how much significance they play in the grand scheme of things. So yes this class was well worth the money thus far. Hopefully I get through the entire class and come out with new knowledge and better understanding of how javascript can work for me. I do enjoy coding. Who would have thought at  ( 71)  I'd find something new and exciting to get into. :)

results.content:
The good:  The explanations are appropriate for absolute beginners, and the class covers a wide range of topics.  The shortcomings:  Other Udemy courses I've taken have had more support around the class (like a robust Q&A, downloadable source code after each lesson, etc.)  and more challenges to check your learning.  Real learning happens when you make your own mistakes and then have to troubleshoot them, and this class makes it too tempting to just watch without participating.   This class would be better if it was architected to enable you to pause the video and do the "homework" lessons on your own before he walks through the answer.  

Also a note to other experienced programmers looking for an intro to object oriented concepts and JavaScript:   I fast-forwarded through more of this class than I thought I would. I took this class after taking some more advanced classes that presumed familiarity with JS when I felt like I needed to take a step back to pick up more of the basics.  While this class did give a shallow overview of concepts I was able to surmise from the more advanced classes, I still don't feel like I have the depth of knowledge presumed for the intermediate/advanced classes.
results.content_html:
The good: The explanations are appropriate for absolute beginners, and the class covers a wide range of topics. The shortcomings: Other Udemy courses I've taken have had more support around the class (like a robust Q&A, downloadable source code after each lesson, etc.) and more challenges to check your learning. Real learning happens when you make your own mistakes and then have to troubleshoot them, and this class makes it too tempting to just watch without participating. This class would be better if it was architected to enable you to pause the video and do the "homework" lessons on your own before he walks through the answer.

Also a note to other experienced programmers looking for an intro to object oriented concepts and JavaScript: I fast-forwarded through more of this class than I thought I would. I took this class after taking some more advanced classes that presumed familiarity with JS when I felt like I needed to take a step back to pick up more of the basics. While this class did give a shallow overview of concepts I was able to surmise from the more advanced classes, I still don't feel like I have the depth of knowledge presumed for the intermediate/advanced classes.

results.content: A great course. Each lesson develops a new skill, building on the previous lesson's content. Instructions are to the point and  easy to understand while being detailed enough that even less tech savvy students won't feel overwhelmed. Would definitely recommend!

results.content: I have done several online courses before, but this one takes the cake! The speaker is clear, energetic and breaks things down into understandable pieces - I love the step-by-step approach he took. It is also excellently produced with slick visuals and the audio was clean and clear. Highly recommend!
